intro: Lastrea longicuspis, commonly known as the long-cusped lastrea, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native range.
